oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conceptualizing Math Ridas in Equity-Oriented Urban Classrooms

Orr, Sheila
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: urban mathematics education
urban teaching
equity
Teachers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Drawing from Duncan-Andrade’s (2007) conceptualization of a Rida [teacher] in urban areas, we sought to understand the ways in which PK-12 urban math teachers engage in the practices that characterize a Ridas’ classroom. Guided by the five pillars of effective practice in Rida’s classrooms, we conducted a qualitative metasynthesis of the research focusing on equity-oriented pedagogies in PK-12 urban mathematics classrooms. From this study, we provide the math education community with a description of instructional practices to consider in Ridas’ math classrooms as well as direction for future research to understand Ridas [math teachers] better. This study has implications for the preparation of future math teachers in different urban spaces.
